intro: Rapuntium bifidum, commonly known as the bifid buttercup, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers with five petals. The plant has compound leaves that are divided into two parts, giving it its scientific name. It typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodland areas and stream banks. The flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
